headline: Creators can now build Linktree storefronts with Target products
summary: Target (TGT) is stepping into the creator economy through a strategic partnership with Linktree. The collaboration will enable creators to seamlessly integrate Target products and other brand offerings into their Linktree sites, providing consumers with a more streamlined shopping experience. Linktree CEO and Co-Founder Alex Zaccaria explains the significance of this partnership during on Asking for a Trend. The platform will now allow influencers to create digital storefronts featuring Target products, making it easier for consumers to discover and purchase items through their favorite social media personalities. Zaccaria emphasizes the growing importance of social commerce, highlighting the rise of shopping features on platforms like TikTok and Instagram. "Linktree is really all about being able to unify all of that into one place," he notes, acknowledging the challenges creators face with constantly changing algorithms and the increasing demands of content creation. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend here. This post was written by Angel Smith

headline: Target’s Slide From Cheap Chic to Dull Chore
summary: With customers griping about out-of-stock items, long checkout lines and locked-up products, Target has slid into a sales funk and is losing ground to Walmart and Amazon.

raw.headline: Target’s Slide From Cheap Chic to Dull Chore
raw.summary: With customers griping about out-of-stock items, long checkout lines and locked-up products, Target has slid into a sales funk and is losing ground to Walmart and Amazon.
